se.onescaleone.sweetblue
Class SweetBlue

java.lang.Object
  se.onescaleone.sweetblue.SweetBlue

public class SweetBlue
extends java.lang.Object

This is a template class and can be used to start a new processing library or tool. Make sure you rename this class as well as the name of the example package 'template' to your own lobrary or tool naming convention.

isCurrentlySendingData

setCurrentlySendingData

public static boolean setCurrentlySendingData(boolean currentlySendingData)
Function that allows BluetoothWorkers to "steal" the attention for the chatservice. Returns true to the worker if the variable was succesfully set. Returns false if the chatservice is busy.

Parameters:
currentlySendingData -
Returns:

getState

public int getState()

pinMode

public byte[] pinMode(int pin,
                      int mode)
Changes the mode of a pin on the ArduinoBT. example: pinMode( 1, SweetBlue.OUTPUT ); Note: Pins 0, 1, and 7 are a big NO-NO! These pins are connected to the bluetooth communication and reset and shouldn't be used!

Parameters:
pin - number on the ArduinoBT
mode - OUTPUT or INPUT
Returns:
null (if fail) or the sent byte[]

digitalWrite

public void digitalWrite(int pin,
                         int value)
Writes HIGH or LOW to the specified pin on the ArduinoBT. example: ditialWrite( 2, SweetBlue.HIGH );

Parameters:
pin - number on the ArduinoBT
value - HIGH or LOW

digitalRead

public void digitalRead(int pin,
                        int[] variable)
Reads value from pin.

Parameters:
pin -
variable -

analogWrite

public void analogWrite(int pin,
                        int value)
Writes value to the specified pin on the ArduinoBT. example: analogWrite( 2, 127 );

Parameters:
pin - number on the ArduinoBT
value - 0 - 255

analogRead

public void analogRead(int pin,
                       int[] variable)
Reads value from pin. IMPORTANT! To "fix" the issue of pass-by-value on primitives, we need the variable to be non-primitive. An array will do fine for solving this initially.

Parameters:
pin - The pin number to read
variable - variable to which the reading should be written.
